| Type | Description | Link | | ---- | ----------- | ---- | | Fix | Disable C2 compilation for problematic structure in JDK 11.0.16

See https://bugs.openjdk.org/browse/JDK-8291665 | https://github.com/palantir/sls-packaging/pull/1372 |

| Type | Description | Link | | ---- | ----------- | ---- | | Improvement | Disable C2 compiler for Java 11

Disable the C2 compiler using the -XX:TieredStopAtLevel=1 flag. This prevents a potential memory leak issue https://bugs.openjdk.org/browse/JDK-8291665 | https://github.com/palantir/sls-packaging/pull/1370 |

* [improvement] Support resolving the sls publication via variant-aware resolution (#531)
* [fix] Update yourKit (#530) 
* [fix] Check if java plugin is applied before accessing jar task (#524)

* [fix] Revert regression introduced in 3.7.3 (#513) 
* [fix] Explicitly set newRatio=2 (#505)
_identical to 3.7.3, just a failed publish_

- [fix] YourKit b112 -> b117 (#501)
- [fix] Use pom extension for product dependencies (#500)
- [fix] go-java-launcher now tolerates newlines in pidfiles (#490)
[fix] `com.palantir.recommended-product-dependencies` is now usable with `gradle-consistent-versions` (#488)
[feature] Expose product dependencies as a configuration (#484)
[fix] Fix missing jars in classpath of generared in jar MANIFEST (#477)

[fix] Fix accidental use of gradle 5 API (#462)

This fixes a regression introduced in 3.6.0 which made sls-packaging require gradle 5.
sls-packaging should now once again support gradle 4.10+.
[fix] All product dependencies are correctly discovered (#457)
[improvement] createManifest no longer requires compiling project source code
[fix] Declare dependency on safe-logging to pick up correct minimum version
- [improvement] Derive max version in closure if missing (#437)

_// tagged on the release/2.x branch_

- [improvement] go-java-launcher 1.5.1 -> 1.6.1, to allow `$JAVA_11_HOME` (#439)
_// same as 3.4.0, publishing was broken_
* [improvement] log what artifacts are making what recommendations (#432)
* [fix] Allow merging non-orderable minimum versions if they are equal (#435)

- [fix] Sensible defaults for providers (#434) 
- [fix] Fix regression with `./gradlew run` (#431)
- [fix] go-java-launcher 1.6.0 -> 1.6.1 to allow digits in process name (#433)
[fix] Don't inject services that require gradle 5.2 (#430)
- [improvement] The `productDependency {}` closure is now evaluated lazily, not at configuration time (#427)

- [improvement] When enabled, hprof heap dumps are written to var/log #424 
- [feature] distributions can now be configured with `javaHome: '$JAVA_11_HOME'` #426

[fix] `createManifest` is always run as part of `check` (#420) 
[fix] Fix different `distribution.productDependencyConfig` being ignored in favor of default (#422)

- [feature] Add `getMinimumProductVersion` utility (#416)
- [fix] Re-run CreateManifestTask if lock file changed (#419)

* [fix] Mask minimum dependency from lockfile on service pubished in repo if same as project version (#414)
* [fix] don't try to look for product dependencies inside non jar artifacts (#415)

- [break] _Product Dependencies_ are now inferred automatically from dependencies.  Previously, you'd have to opt-in to this behaviour by specifying `detectConstraints = true`. Now that this is on by default, you can safely delete all these productDependency blocks:

    ```diff
    -productDependency {
    -  productGroup = 'com.palantir.timelock'
    -  productName = 'timelock'
    -  detectConstraints = true
    -}
    ```
    It is also recommended to delete explicitly declared blocks and switch to the inferred style if possible:
    ```diff
    -productDependency {
    -    productGroup = 'com.palantir.group'
    -    productName = 'some-service'
    -    minimumVersion = dependencyRecommendations.getRecommendedVersion('com.palantir.group', 'some-service-api')
    -    maximumVersion = "${minimumVersion.tokenize('.')[0].toInteger()}.x.x"
    -    recommendedVersion = dependencyRecommendations.getRecommendedVersion('com.palantir.group', 'some-service')
    -}
    ```


- [feature] Any project with Product Dependencies is now required to have a `product-dependencies.lock` file checked in (example below). The `createManifest` task verifies this lock file is an up-to-date representation of the current state of the world and will refuse to proceed if it's out of date.  Run `./gradlew --write-locks` to update it.  This ensures that it is still easy to code-review changes to inferred product dependencies.

    ```
    com.palantir.cassandra:sls-cassandra (3.24.0, 3.x.x)
    com.palantir.timelock:timelock-server (0.51.0, 0.x.x)
    ```

- [break] A minimum version of Gradle 4.10 is now required (to support the `--write-locks` argument)

name: 3.0.0-rc4
body: - [improvement] `product-dependencies.lock` file & ./gradlew createManifest --write-locks (#409)

name: 3.0.0-rc3
body:
- [fix] createManifest is usable on a dirty repo (#406)
- [improvement] More conspicuous logging (#407)

name: 3.0.0-rc2
body:
* [fix] Don't include self dependencies (#404) 
* [fix] (readme) link to recommended product dependencies plugin (#405)

name: 3.0.0-rc1
body: [break] Import product dependencies from libraries automatically (#402, #403)

- [fix] Ensure `gc: response-time` works on Java11 (#370)
- [improvement] This plugins has been translated from Groovy -> Java. No behaviour changes.

name: 2.22.0-rc6
body: * [fix] revert regression in copy tasks (#398)

name: 2.22.0-rc5
body:
[improvement] pretty print manifest (#395)
[fix] fix asset structure (#396)

name: 2.22.0-rc4
body: - [fix] Restore old setter methods (without set*) and add lazy setters (#393)

name: 2.22.0-rc3
body: - [fix] Ensure `gc: response-time` works on Java11 (#370)

name: 2.22.0-rc2
body:
[improvement] Remove duplicate sls version (#390)
[fix] copyTasks don't fail if artifacts already exist (#387)

name: 2.22.0-rc1
body: [improvement] Migrate to Java (#385)
[fix] don't print G1 gc stats (#380)
[fix] Response time 11 should not be final (#375)
- [improvement] Add `gc: response-time-11` profile using shenandoahgc (#371)

- [improvement] Push init.sh --help through to go-init. (#335)
- [fix] Use runtimeClasspath to detect product dependencies (#354)
- [improvement] Generated JVM options should now be Java-11 compatible. Set `addJava8GCLogging true` to bring back Java-8 specific options.

# Improvements
* Prevent `init.sh status` from spamming service.log (#333)
* Add -XX:+CMSScavengeBeforeRemark to response-time (#326)
- [fix] orderable recommended versions are used only during manifest creation instead of task creation (#324)

- Add first class gc setting (#312)
- Use go-init as replacement for init.sh and allow for multi-process services (#317)

name: 2.18.0-rc1
body:
- Add first class gc setting (#312)
- Use go-init as replacement for init.sh and allow for multi-process services (#317)
- [improvement] `hs_err_pid%p.log` files outputted by the JVM when it crashes will now be written into the `var/log` directory, instead of landing in the service root. (#314)
- `kill -9` if process fails to stop (#309)

* [improvement] Revert #306 (#311)

This should be functionally equivalent to 2.13.4.
Will block on https://github.com/palantir/go-java-launcher/pull/49 instead before picking up go-init.
- [improvement] Update init.sh to use go-init (#306)
* Actually fix publishing to Gradle Portal (the `publishPlugins` task) (#300)
* Fix unresolved dependency versions for the `publishPlugins` task (#299)
* Fix publishing (#298)
- Automatically merge overlapping RecommendedProductDependencies (#293)
- identical to 2.12.0 except for using gradle 4.7
- Set env MALLOC_ARENA_MAX=4 by default (#284)
- package libyjpagent.so in dist tars (#275)

name: 2.11.0-rc1
body: - package libyjpagent.so in dist tars (#275)
- DNS cache entries now expire after 20 seconds rather than staying forever (`sun.net.inetaddr.ttl` JVM option). (#273)

name: 2.10.0-rc3
body: - Move to using `(M|G|T)` instead of `(MB|GB|TB)` notations for pod volume definitions (#270)

name: 2.10.0-rc2
body: - Upgrade jackson to match gradle 4.4 (#268)

name: 2.10.0-rc1
body:
- Updating the exception message for missing productDependencies (#255)
- Pod Distribution support (#265)
- Add task to create configuration tarballs (#263)
(Republishing due to CI flake)

- Change sleep value to 5 seconds in init.sh (#256)
- Add daemon.v1 to list of valid product types (#257)

* Fix exclude pattern, allow custom scripts (#249)
* Force unlimited width in ps output (#250)
* no longer match with full path, since mac os uses different path strings (#248)
- Fix product recommendations to include self-references (#245)

- Use gradle project name by default (#228)
- Fix is_process_service (#233)
- Ensure that minimumVersion and maximumVersion are not equal (#230)
- Make minimumVersion required in ProductDependency (#237) 
- support 0755 perms for custom scripts (#240)
- Document properties of `productDependency` (#239)
- Change VersionMatcher format: must contain at least one trailing wildcard (#191)
- Add ability to generate product-dependencies from published recommendations (#242)
- Add plugin to set recommended product dependencies (#243)
- Allow duplicate recommendations provided they are equal (#244)

- Support absolute paths in asset distribution definition (#219)
- Add ability to specify mavenCoord for version range and recommended version (#216)

name: 2.4.0-rc1
body: - more concise productDependency behavior
- actually resolve bad runtime classpath encoding

- Add support for project dependencies on Gradle 3.4 java-library projects (#205)
- [BUGFIX] Make expected Java tmp directory in go-java-launcher/init script rather than TGZ (#209)
- Add jar.archivePath to classpath of run task (#207)

name: 2.3.0-rc1
body:
- Add support for project dependencies on Gradle 3.4 java-library projects (#205)
- [BUGFIX] Make expected Java tmp directory in init script rather than TGZ (#209)
- Add jar.archivePath to classpath of run task (#207)
- [BREAK] No longer accept beta version, accept orderable rc-snapshot versions

- No longer allow "." in suffix of non-orderable version strings
- Allow "1.0.0.dirty" as a non-orderable version string
- Add support for custom extensions of the form `init-<custom>.sh` to the init.sh script mechanism

**API-breaking and config-breaking release**

**New features&behaviour**
- Adds support for specifying product dependencies in the SLS manifest
- Adds `-XX+CrashOnOutOfMemoryError` JVM option to Java service startup configuration (requires at least Java 8u92, see http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/8u92-relnotes-2949471.html)

**Upgrade notes**
- Plugins were renamed to:
  - com.palantir.sls-asset-distribution
  - com.palantir.sls-java-service-distribution
- Maven coordinates were renamed to `com.palantir.sls-packaging:gradle-sls-packaging:2.0.0`

name: 2.0.0-alpha3
body: Test publishing with new project structure

name: 2.0.0-alpha2
body: Test publishing after renaming project to sls-packaging.

name: 2.0.0-alpha1
body: Test publishing after renaming project to sls-packaging.

- Add support for asset distributions
- [BREAKING] Require SLS-compatible format for version strings
- Adds support for specifying service dependencies in SLS manifest file

name: 1.4.0-rc1
body: - Add new com.palantir.asset-distribution plugin
- Check scripts no longer contain GC-related JVM options. This reduces pollution of the log directory with GC logs.

- Update license file for consistency (#140)
- Tasks should not reach into the Gradle object model (#134)
- Add extensions block to manifest (#143)
- Re-run LaunchConfigTask when classpath changes, fixes #144 (#155)

name: 1.2.0-rc4
body:
- Update license file for consistency (#140)
- Tasks should not reach into the Gradle object model (#134)
- Add extensions block to manifest (#143)
- Re-run LaunchConfigTask when classpath changes, fixes #144 (#155)

name: 1.2.0-rc3
body:
Since 1.2.0-rc2
- Publish them harder (#150)

Since 1.2.0-rc1
- Publish RC tags (#149)

Since 1.1.0:
- Update license file for consistency (#140)
- Tasks should not reach into the Gradle object model (#134)
- Add extensions block to manifest (#143)

name: 1.2.0-rc2
body:
Since 1.2.0-rc1
- Publish RC tags (#149)

Since 1.1.0:
- Update license file for consistency (#140)
- Tasks should not reach into the Gradle object model (#134)
- Add extensions block to manifest (#143)

name: 1.2.0-rc1
body:
Since 1.1.0:
- Update license file for consistency (#140)
- Tasks should not reach into the Gradle object model (#134)
- Add extensions block to manifest (#143)
- Adds support for specifying compile-time environment variables
- Support better incremental builds by declaring task input/outputs explicitly
- [BREAKING from 0.10.x] Uses `kebab-case` fields in manifest.yml, adds `product-type: service.v1` field in manifest.yml
- Do not force dependency resolution during configuration phase

- Include timestamp and process ID in GC log file name
- [POSSIBLY BREAKING] Remove special /dev/urandom java option. This change is mostly no-op for Java8 services, but changes behaviour for Java7 services, cf. https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/security/enhancements-8.html .
- include GC logs in `var/log/gc.log` by default
- Remove default application of `-XX:+PerfDisableSharedMem` in JVM options
- artifacts are now produced with an extension of `.sls.tgz` (instead of just `.tgz`) to help indicate that they conform with the layout described by the readme
- use newest go-java-launcher (1.0.1) for better error messaging when the Java executable cannot be found
- Add "sls" Gradle configuration that exposes the generated tgz as an artifact

- Add -XX:+PerfDisableSharedMem flag by default. Consequently, tools like jstack, jinfo, jps will no longer work out of this box. This behaviour can be overridden by setting -XX:-PerfDisableSharedMem in launcher-custom.yml. This change improves performance by avoiding GC pauses when writing stats to a memory-mapped file under /tmp: http://www.evanjones.ca/jvm-mmap-pause.html.

The 0.6.0 release of gradle-java-distribution plugin replaces the Bash-based launch mechanism by a compiled
Go binary. Configuration is done via the generated `service/bin/launcher-static.yml` file. The Bash scripts are still generated, but considered deprecated, at least as far as the `init.sh` script is concerned.

NOTE: Custom JVM arguments can no longer be set via JVM_OPTS environment variables and must instead be defined in `var/conf/launcher-custom.yml`.
- prefer Java 8 environment variables in check script
- Produce `service/monitoring/bin/check.sh` when `checkArgs` is included as a configuration option
- move temp directory to `var/data/tmp` for safety
- Java temp directory now defaults to `var/tmp/files`
- exclude directories from `var` using new `excludeFromVar` option (contributed by @sfackler)
- default JVM arguments automatically include a change to use `/dev/urandom` as the entropy source
- stopping a service now waits for up to ~240s, checking once per second to see if the process has stopped
- resolves a bug where distTar output names might not render correctly outside of an afterEvaluafe block
- **(breaking)** switch from generating `manifest.yaml` to `manifest.yml`

- Add `service/bin/config.sh` for easier end-user customization in non-managed environments
- Support `javaHome` configuration option (and populate config.sh)
- Build with Gradle 2.10
- run task correctly respects `defaultJvmArgs`
- add `console` option to `init.sh` to enable running the application in the foreground.
- use `enableManifestClasspath` to create a jar with a manifest containing build classpath to shorten classpath for Windows environments

- includes `${projectDir}/deployment/` in produced artifacts
- excludes `${projectDir}/var/log` and `${projectDir}/var/run` from produced artifacts
- always renders project versions to strings
- set `defaultJvmOpts` in the distribution block
- Build with Gradle 2.8
- Build with Gradle 2.7

- Improvements to init.sh
  - work correctly on Mac OS
  - add restart option
  - display PID in success states
- Removes unnecessary dependency on Guava
- Corrects the distributed init.sh script to automatically create var/log if it does not exist.
- Make gradle-java-distribution plugin generally available
